name: HTML, CSS, and Javascript for Web Developers
reviews: Excellent! Knowledge deployed in the course are very complete! In personally repeated each lesson and study the foundations several times, since there are things that suddenly overlook but if it is considered the time that the course lasts (5 weeks) is more than understandable. Trying to go beyond would require much more time. However I return and repeat the contained content is quite, and at the end of these in full ability to start contributing to web development projects. Really excellent and much of the quality of this course is due to Yaakov and the dynamic tutoring of him and at all boring. Greetings!

name: HTML, CSS, and Javascript for Web Developers
reviews: Excellent course, the teacher is extremely clear to teach concepts. He teaches all the necessary details for you as a student do not stay with "the bridge with tables less" as it is common in YouTube courses made by amateurs. It shows the quality that imparts both the teacher and the support of the university in which what matters most, is that you learn. Saludos!

reviews: I am very happy to have taken this course which I consider it "intense" but very updated on the theme of HTML JS and CSS. It is fascinating. Thank you.

name: Introduction to Negotiation: A Strategic Playbook for Becoming a Principled and Persuasive Negotiator
reviews: I have been working the last 15 years in the commercial area, which required innumerable successful negotiations (and others not so much). However, this course has given me new tools and concepts, which I am sure will facilitate my next negotiations. I recommend this course at 100%, I enjoyed it, I have laughed, and above all I have learned a lot. I believe that none of this would have been possible without the charismatic Professor Barry, who managed to motivate me during the whole course with its elementary classes and above all its gift of people, to the point of enjoying each class as if it were a child opening the Christmas gifts!

reviews: Great, Yale shows that it is a world top world. Many thanks to Barry Nalebuff to share the experience of the Yale Som MBA and for sharing experts like Linda Babcock and Herb Cohen. name: Learning How to Learn: Powerful mental tools to help you master tough subjects
reviews: The course is very good. Its intentionality and commitment is ideal. However, I encounter certain insufficiently supported explanations, since a very high percentage of understanding is left, or of the content assimilation in the hands of the student. Meeting that basic points are explanted extensively, while others that can be key, can be suggested too abstract and brief. Yes, I think it should emphasize those content that explain in a scientific way (not too technical) the functioning of the brain as a basis for explaining the influence of habits in the outcome we finally obtain from the course and in general. Since they help a lot to understand what habits make you fail or improve in your learning purposes and also help you feel personally identified and more committed and involved with the objectives of the course.

name: Learning How to Learn: Powerful mental tools to help you master tough subjects
reviews: Excellent, the techniques taught in the course at the time of  Studying, I am putting them into practice and I worked. I keep working  in the application of the Pomodoro method, since I was used to studying  All content two days before an exam and finally did not get  The results you wanted. The repetition technique I have always applied it and it has  Worked for learning to be. The breath is very important to be able to relax,  that relaxed we can see and focus learning from another perspective

name: Learning How to Learn: Powerful mental tools to help you master tough subjects
reviews: The concrete course quite well some of the methodologies that each student develops autonomously, allowing the mind to open in other ways of addressing the study at the content level and at the level of personal disposal towards the content. Finally, "learning to learn" allows to demolish common myths about learning and practices that could be considered "bad practices" within the personal learning process. Highly recommended!

name: Learning How to Learn: Powerful mental tools to help you master tough subjects
reviews: The course has valuable tools, it requires acquiring the habit through continuous concentrations, among which I emphasize for the elaboration of metaphors and analogies, as well as developing the practice in the use of the Palace of Memory. Thanks to the interviewees that provided their experiences and their very important study techniques. Once again, I thank Dr. Oakley and Dr Sejnowski.

name: Learning How to Learn: Powerful mental tools to help you master tough subjects
reviews: I often tell others that the greatest lesson I learned by going to college was "learning how I learn best." And yet, when I reflect on my undergraduate career (I graduated in 2012), it occurs to me that I didn't truly reach my potential as a learner. The flawed learning techniques I gleaned in high school stayed with me for my college years -- I crammed nightly before exams; I took cursory looks at a homework set's answer key and convinced myself that I knew the topic; rather than admit to myself that I was letting procrastination get control over my life, I convinced myself that, "I work well under a little pressure," or that I simply didn't "have time to go to review sessions/attend office hours/review my work/etc." I may have been able to graduate with decent grades, but I certainly couldn't recall from memory the majority of the work I did.And so, I've been left feeling like I've failed myself; like I didn't truly achieve my potential as a learner. "Who would I be today," I sometimes muse, "if only I applied myself and gave learning my all?" But I can't play the "woe is me" game anymore. I may have not taken advantage of the learning opportunities I had at the time, but I can certainly do better for myself going forward.Taking Dr. Oakley's course, supplemented by reading her book, "A Mind for Numbers" has changed my life. It's altered my perspective about learning and memory, and it's given me insight into how brains learn best, and how I can maximize my success and efficiency when it comes to learning. To give you an idea of the impact of Dr. Oakley's insight on my life: I originally borrowed her book "A Mind for Numbers" from my local library; when I finished it, I immediately bought a copy for my personal collection -- in part, to have on hand, should my friends and family ask to read it; but more importantly, I bought the book to serve as a reference for myself in the years to come, when I may need to remind myself on the best tips and methods for learning. This course taught me how to learn, something I took for granted during my formative educational years. I can't wait to see where I end up in the future, now that I'm armed with the tools, techniques, and resources I need to succeed!

name: Learning How to Learn: Powerful mental tools to help you master tough subjects

Bilingual Person And A 29 Year Old Man Who Never Believed He Could Be An A + Student I Recommend to Lot This Course, Not Only Because It Has Helped Me On The Academic Aspect Of My Life But Also In My Personal Life, I Even Use The Pomodoro Technique To Clean My Room, I Am Forever Grateful With The Doctors Barbara Oakley and Terry Sejnowsky For Taking The Time To do This Course, I Really Enjoyed It A Lot And I Learned Much More About "How to Learn", Without A Dobut Is Something That I Plan To Teach to Future Generations.Thanks A Lot Barbara Oakley And Terry Sejnowski .... name: Machine Learning
reviews: Well, this course has at least 3 undeniable cons:1. It exist;2. It offers certificate for reasonable and affordable price;3. It has "Stanford" in title.Still, it could be improved in many ways.First of all, it has poor video and audio quality, maybe worst I've personally seen in MOOC. Dear Stanford! Professor Ng is cool, give him room with windows, 1080p camera and microphone! Even less famous educational establishments can afford it.Second, subtitles are also poor. English is not my native language but I dropped subs in my language after first try. English subtitles also have a lot of errors: many words are garbled with homonyms; I'm lucky to have some background in course theme and without it I would be completely lost trying to understand what's even going on.Third, I think this and many other courses are suffering from past teaching system and experience. What is classical teaching system? There is lecturer narrating and writing on the board, sometimes showing something; there are students listening and taking notes. Well, still better than "watch your master working, nothing will be explained" method (still present in some cultures), but what century it is? XVII, XIX? We are learning "Machine Learning" via Internet, and watching materials being hand-written in process? Seriously? Even basic HTML skills in this days are enough to show formula, where you can get reminders of it's every part by simply moving cursor on it (Wikipedia is one example). After two weeks break in learning it will be very effective way to remember fast "what's going on, why this formula is so big and what the hell is that squiggle", and learning process will be improved greatly.Little more HTML effort, and there will be way to live demonstrate curves, planes and how different parameters affect them; it will be possible to let students experiment while learning which is great improvement for learning, memorizing and understanding. These are just examples, but hopefully my point is clear.Quizes are too easy, solvable with "hey he just said that" method and some intuition, not require deep understanding. Programming assignments are well prepared and explained, but programming materials amount is not enough for me. Thank you professor Ng for your efforts!

name: Machine Learning
reviews: The course seems to me that it is generally very well, but it has certain problems, as not guiding the previous process of programming exercises, I mean that there are no videos where something of what is seen is programmed because when performing the exercises Something very specific but is not fully understood the exercise because it is not known how the other modules work and as interacting between them. For the rest, very well, I understood the theory and my English is not very good.

name: Machine Learning
reviews: In my opinion, the course should be renewed for this more up-to-date, with better and more detailed explanations. The delivery of programming tasks became excessively complicated to deliver for the simple and shallow explanation they give in the course, since there are new ways to solve these tasks more intuitively and easy.

name: Machine Learning
reviews: The teacher a 10! Excellent Andrew, Congrats and Thank You. The only weak point of the course is that it is quite outdated in some things because of the years that have happened. Anyway it is very helpful and it makes you very clear about the concepts and functioning of the algorithms, which is ideal to correctly manage the libraries available today. The course I found it super complete and is the one that goes deeper within the Operation of the algorithms, which allows you to truly know how they work. It is not one of the many courses that only help you manage the libraries. In summary, it is very helpful, very complete and super well explained and orderly. Too bad that is getting a little old. Anyway, I think it's the ideal course to start on the subject.

name: Machine Learning
reviews: Solid foundational knowledge for those starting in ML. I like the structure of the class overall, building up on content of previous section, and the choice of MatLab as the the language/programming environment. I'd wish there was more time spent on mathematical aspects (e.g. for PCA or backprop), but I do understand that's probably unrealistic for an online class, and the additional theory could be gained elsewhere. Good practical advice on optimizing and tuning the ML systems (e.g. week 6), though appreciating this knowledge probably takes more practical applications. Finally, I found the quiz sections in Week10/Week11 to be more cursory compared to the other weeks, and wish there were practical assignments in the last two sections.

name: Machine Learning
reviews: Good course to start in automatic learning. The videos are well structured and explain very simple for people without experience in limited algebra. On the other hand, I recommend that if you want to start this course you have notions of linear algebra, and in this way that is not a mere course where to learn everything from Blow, know how to apply it but do not really get to "internalize it" as a critical I would like I would like to be able to access additional information about the mathematical demonstrations that "let it fall" during the lessons.

name: Machine Learning
reviews: Gently-paced and reasonable in terms of course work load, even for a busy person. This course greatly demystified machine learning for me. Alvin's lectures are friendly and easy to follow, and progress smoothly from one point of interest to the next, always taking time to briefly recap on precursor topics that were previously discussed.I really appreciate how the assignments focus on the core algorithms and their implementation. Ancillary implementation steps and a scaffolding for testing and viewing the results are already given for the learner to use, play with, and go back and reference for educational purposes if need be, for refreshing on use of tools such as plotting methods. The way the assignments are structured, putting emphasis on filling in the gaps with implementation of the important algorithms, makes completing assignments a very satisfying and fulfilling experience. I feared I would get caught up in preliminary steps, i.e. getting plots to display correctly or cleaning up the data, but that's all taken care of so that one can focus on practicing the techniques most relevant to the topic and algorithms.I only wish there were more assignments to complete, both to cover more of the course's material and to have more chances to practice algorithm prototyping in Octave/Matlab.

name: Machine Learning
reviews: I took the course in 2020. I am a student of economics (already had a good base of statistics), had a basic knowledge of programming and knew a bit of Machine Learning. In my opinion, Andrew Ng has a good didactics and is very nice to learn from someone's renowned in the area. The course served to give good notions of ML, made the subject much more tangible and gave an interesting panorama. The programming tasks took me a long time and had some difficulties but I managed to complete everything with some help. The program used is Octave (or MATLAB). It was not difficult to adapt to this environment. However, it seems to me that the software choice may have stayed a little outdated, maybe it would be more interesting in Python. I do not know how difficult it is to adapt the code and libraries. In any case, this does not affect the explanation of ML models or even the advice and good practices presented. I have no basis for comparing with other ML courses available.
reviewers: By Guilherme C d A S

name: Machine Learning

reviews: I think is the best course with which you can start in this science, 100% recommended, not only learn the concepts, also apply them in Octave / Matlab, which gives you an idea of how to start developing in other languages, it costs a little to adapt to the rhythm of the course compared to other online courses, but it is worth the effort, people interested in the course I recommend them on what they can so that they take the time well especially in week 9, which I consider it for me It was the week that more time consummented me, however the subject is quite interesting for those who like to have a small vision of how some of the technologies of the Giants can work on the network, in the same way I recommend them carry their own annotations in A review notebook is always useful.

name: Machine Learning
reviews: The course gives a very clear foundation for machine learning. The course is by no means complete or comprehensive, but given the vastness of the subject that is not possible either. A substantial amount is covered every week in the lectures, and completing the assignments definitely made me feel like I learned something. The quizzes are well crafted and gauge not just cursory, but deeper understanding of concepts. The instructor, Prof. Ng makes the lectures very engaging, and teaches everything in a structured manner.The only improvements this course needs is with regards to comprehensiveness. For students who wish to delve even deeper into the concepts mathematically, there should be more optional lectures. Lacking that, a list of further reference material will certainly be of big help.

name: Machine Learning
reviews: Very good course. You can see the desire and taste to teach Professor Andrew, so that motivates you to continue advancing in the course and learn even more than what you see here. 100% recommended to anyone who likes these topics, even if you do not have a very finished knowledge of programming or elementary mathematics. I also emphasize the work of the tutors who have a great willingness to help through the forum. Without them, everything would have been much slower and more complicated. The resources, as well as the forum and the tutorials are of the utmost importance and, in my opinion, are well designed so that students can really resolve their doubts.

But you will learn a lot from the root of Machine Learning and Mathematics and Statistics involved in the process. A course that generates controversy since we all have different concepts of what is generated by happiness and ended up coinciding with the same conclusions: being grateful, doing acts of kindness with others, having a social connection, enjoying the moment, sleeping well, exercising and meditating. ..happiness is a chosen state of mind!

name: Financial Markets
reviews: I am happy to have completed this course, it is really good to know the important issues that determine the functioning of the markets and gives me elements to be able to invest. Also, note that it helped me to better move the quarantine period (Covid-19) in a positive way and occupy this time confined in personal growth. The course is very well structured on all themes and the teacher is very good pedagogue , at the same time, he does it with a touch of humor. Finally, the interviews and presentations are good, to show that also through finances, good things can be done for humanity. Grab Coursera, Yale University and Mr. Shiller.

name: Financial Markets
reviews: I THING THIS COURSE WAS VERY USEFUL AS AN Introduction to Financial Markets. The Professor Is Vary Enthusiastic and Committed to What HE Teaches. Its A Pity That There Are People That Things This Course Is a Waste of Time. IF You Want to Know What I Think About This People, You Can Use Google Translator As an Example That You Can Search For What You Do not Know on The Internet. For my part this course was very useful as an introduction to financial markets, full of examples and that changed my perspective of financial markets. I have read the opinions of the course and are very varied, but there is a special thing that bothered me too much. A subject named James R. says to be a doctor (I do not know what) and have almost 20 years of entitular teacher (who knows where). He is criticizing the course claiming that there are many things not explained or that they are not in the course. However, I think it is enough to put the definition on the Internet to find it. While many formulas are not explained, I am sure that reason is because in order to explain where they would need more theory. I do not know if people are not able to read before this course is for beginners, the important thing is to understand the concepts as such, know that they exist, is designed for people who do not have advanced knowledge in finance or economy.

name: Financial Markets

name: AI For Everyone
reviews: This was my first course on artificial intelligence, so this should be taken into consideration in my evaluation - that is, whoever is read should know that. Another important point is that I have no technical background. That said, the course was quite valid as a first step to understand what was going and, especially, what I need to take into consideration when I think of "creating" an application in IA or when a company thinks of doing something like this. I was able to walk the first steps in this understanding. What would be important as a suggestion is a continuation of the course, giving tips of what we should seek according to our goals and degree of knowledge. In short, I can not comment on the quality of the course for those who already have a background on the subject. But for people who, like me, have no knowledge or technical training, the course is valid.
reviewers: By Luis A S d A

name: Neural Networks and Deep Learning
reviews: The course reconciles a comprehensive approach - starting from intuitive / elementary concepts - with a respectable depth - building with more in-depth techniques. Classes are extremely didactic and well elaborated, which makes familiarization with the concepts of neural networks (and mathematics behind them) more natural. Assessments have both a theoretical component (quizzes, most focused on verification of knowledge) as a practical (programming exercises). As much as it is positive to be the practical component, I would say that it could be a little less "guided" - in practice, what they ask is that the student "Complete the gaps" in a program already structured (and practically completed) by teachers. I felt the need to complement these exercises with self-account attempts by programming the zero algorithms to ensure that I can implement what I learned. This step is significantly harder than the course programs (after all, implementing a zero project is essentially challenging). Even so, I see that this type of "initiative" to bring content learned to some application / practice beyond the request by the course is something that should ideally be done by studying any discipline. Excellent course.

name: Neural Networks and Deep Learning
reviews: The first course of the specialization does not only present you deep learning in a theoretical way but is reinforced with the exercises developed in the Python language. Finishing with a guided construction of a 4-layer neuronal network and understanding each step because they are properly raised in defined functions. I recommend seeing every video in detail and take notebooks, as well as, practice yourself by implementing the functions and decipher that is what you do each line of code from a start to avoid getting lost afterwards (Recommendation: Read the forums). Excellent course

name: Stanford Introduction to Food and Health
reviews: I really liked the videos and the contents. In general, I found a fairly complete course. As a constructive criticism I can say that I was surprised that despite recommending that food should be based mostly on the consumption of vegetables and fruits, no more information or vegan recipes will not present. I think that the course could be greatly enriched with more content that sustain what they said on many occasions about the consumption of vegetables. Currently there are infinity of reliable sources of information that show that the greatest number of chronic preventable degenerative diseases has its origin in the consumption of products of animal origin, in addition to the products (which are not food) processed and excess food, as they said . Another suggestion that would help a greater credibility, is to have opinions of other experts apart from M. Pollan, because it seems as if he were the only one in the art. Thanks :-)

name: Stanford Introduction to Food and Health
reviews: I really liked the course because it focuses on the important information that an ordinary person should know about nutrition, making us more aware of the quality of our food, sustained in a basic but very important knowledge that we should eat, how much we should eat and as we should eat Eat them. I stay with the phrase eat food, (real food, not processed), not much (taking care of the size of the portions), mostly vegetables (recommend in its most fruits and vegetables).

name: Stanford Introduction to Food and Health
reviews: This course was great for an introductory course to food and health because it emphasized getting back to the basics of real food and cooking simply. It lost a star because I felt like there were certain topics that needed a more in depth and less cursory approach. They were almost dismissive at times for the sake of "keeping it simple" whereas a simple suggestion about washing produce to remove pesticides could've been helpful.

name: Stanford Introduction to Food and Health

name: Improving Deep Neural Networks: Hyperparameter tuning, Regularization and Optimization
reviews: The course is very well taught by Andrew NG and allows you to acquire very quickly knowledge about key points to improve learning with neuronal networks in a generic way. The practice practice with the Python tensorflow platform is very valuable, although it is less than more depth in the use of TensorFlow available tools and other Python utilities for neuronal networks. The course uses as didactic examples and practices the application of neuronal networks to the recognition of images, but it would be fine to expand examples with practical applications to other fields as it can be a modeling of a physical process.

name: Improving Deep Neural Networks: Hyperparameter tuning, Regularization and Optimization

name: Improving Deep Neural Networks: Hyperparameter tuning, Regularization and Optimization
reviews: One of the courses I liked the most so far. Since I began to study Deep Learning I see if you talk about many techniques that seemed impossible to understand and implement, but this course not only teaches how to implement some of them, but also helps to understand the reason these techniques are so good for the models of neural networks , giving a good intuition of how each method works. In addition, it presents and helps demystify the TensorFlow framework.
reviewers: By Matheus H B d A

name: Management of Fashion and Luxury Companies
reviews: I Will Give My Opinion in Spanish First and Then En Español. Spanish: The course really liked it a lot! The only thing I really did not like was that it is supposed to be a course to do it anywhere in the world, and it is not so unfortunately. Because to do well, you have to know absolutely everything from Europe at a cultural level. I knew the brands for my trips and for seeing them on social networks, but really in many questions I was difficult for me to respond, not because I did not know the content but because it was something more cultural than of knowledge of the course. It would be nice that they do not think only that everyone who performs the course knows absolutely the history of each European or US brand putting it as examples in the tests. Beyond that, the course is very didactic and enriching. I would recommend it, but only to people who have a prior knowledge of trademarks and European history. Thank you. Daiana Demio @Daidemaio - English: I REALLY LIKED THE COURSE! The Only Thing I Really Didn't Like Was That It is Supposed To Be A Course to Take Anywhere In The World, And Unfortunately It Is Not. Because to Do It Well, You Have to Know Absolutely Everything About Europe On A Cultural Level. I KNEW THE BRANDS From My Trips and from Seeing Them On Social Networks, But in Many Questions It Was Reality Difficult For Me to Answer, Not Because I Did Not Know The Content But Because It Was Something More Cultural Than Knowledge of Course Studies. It Would Be Good IF They Did Not Think Only That Everyone Who Takes The Course Absolutely Knows The History Of Each European Or US Brand, Putting It As Examples In The Tests. Beyond That, The Course Is Vary Educational and Enriching. I Would Recommend It, But Only to People Who Have A Prior Knowledge of European Brands And History. Thank you. Daiana Demio @Daidemaio.

name: Primeros Auxilios Psicológicos (PAP)
reviews: The general theoretical content is good, especially in the theoretical Ingeborg videos. I think it makes very good approaches, and creates a context to understand different situations and great vital cycles. However, other participants read Power Points obviously, in such a way that the spectator ends up disconnecting the possibility of reading the Power Point autonomously faster. The part of the foreign professionals who form in the intervention with deaf people is insufferable - do not move, do not gesticulate, have no rhythm - and that seriously damages both the content that in that particular case is very weak and the transmission. The content in that section is summarized in minutes and minutes of video talking about links from a website, I think it is easier to put a PDF with the links and point. In particular there is one where the professional is recorded sitting in an armchair, without looking at camera, talking about links and links to webs that does not contribute great thing. In the practical part there are instructional videos and others that either stay short, or Emit effective a priori response that after sharing with colleagues we do not consider it. We believe that it is due to the interpretation of a role playing, and we do not doubt the professionalism of the participants. But I think it's something to be improved if you want to convey well the techniques. I am happy because it is a novel issue, and the course is extensive, but I think it can be improved a lot to be a great course, it has potential.

name: Primeros Auxilios Psicológicos (PAP)
reviews: The course focuses more on giving the affected information to seek tools, rather than being a psychological intervention as such. For what I was looking for, it is short, but if what you are looking for is an introduction or being a first contact mediator in case of any type of emergency, this course can be very useful.

reviews: I greatly appreciate this type of courses, touches a theme that is not always addressed, especially in Latin countries, as mine, it is also in a simple language so that anyone can understand it. However, as a neuroditive clinical population and in a situation of disability, it bothers me a little that always speaks of the interveners as healthy people, and from the disabilities as a section, assuming that we can not also be intervening. I study psychology and I have applied paps many times before taking this extraordinary accreditation, so, so that they review it, we, the neurdomtent and disabilities, we can also and we are intervening.

name: Primeros Auxilios Psicológicos (PAP)
reviews: This course has a great relevance at a social level. Initial psychoeducational guidelines after a tragic event are beneficial in the management of stress produced by it. My congratulations to all those who perform this work, to those who train more people in order to apply the PAP and to all what they are encouraged to take the course. Mises comments are focused on the improvement of it. First of all, the materials should be reviewed, since in occasions the information turns out to be extremely repetitive, therefore in occasions the attention is lost. On the other hand, I consider that it must increase the difficulty of the tests, so that it is not tedious to resolve them, but also to evaluate the understanding of information and not only evaluate the repetition of it. Finally, I consider extremely important to spread among those assigned to the course, the ethical relevance of this work; That is, emphasize that not because they have taken the course we can solve all situations: you have to be critical with our practice always seek to prepare more to be trained and attend to these situations. Thank you for your work.

name: Primeros Auxilios Psicológicos (PAP)
reviews: This course (is the first one that I make virtually) seems very easy to understand, has clear presentations, complementary readings that supports the process very well, the hours that says that are required for the process are adequate, participation in the forums generates a important feedback in the process. However, during the week in which people with special conditions are addressed, the video about people with hypoacuchia or deafness seemed unclear, and I do not feel it has given me clear tools for these people, however, the Readings referenced if you have the tools. Additionally, I think it takes the participation of an instructor who clarifies generalized doubts in the learning process.

name: Primeros Auxilios Psicológicos (PAP)
reviews: Good afternoon. My name is Arantxa. Personally, the course seemed dynamic, entertaining, pleasant and very useful, not only occupies its materials as presentations, but also the videos where Role-Playing is enriching. The extension and modality, is comfortable and adequate. The only thing that disappointed me a little, was the cost. I do not have the possibility to obtain the certificate or perseverance, because it seems to me the cost and I would like to acquire it if at some point there is another way to do it. When I started it was at $ 566 it seems to me, and still, I could not have acquired it because of the situation of the Covid-19 that affects our economy. Thank you very much and I hope to make other courses with this quality.

name: Primeros Auxilios Psicológicos (PAP)
reviews: The course I liked because the contents are transmitted in a simple way, allowing them to assimilate easily. It provides general information of the PAP but also contemplates as they should be carried out according to the public affected (children, adolescents, adults, people with disabilities, etc). As a suggestion, I would have liked that in the Defusing and Debriefing techniques the ROLE PLAYING include in the intervention, self-care guidelines for those affected. On the other hand, I think that material could be included about how to organize an emergency scenario, if when arriving at the site there is still no team. The course I recommend it, it is a great contribution. Thank you

name: Primeros Auxilios Psicológicos (PAP)
reviews: In general, very well structured, the content is clear and complete. However, the fact that the speakers read in front of a monotonous tone makes it heavy. The instructions for the final deliverable can be clearer and more specific, the final parts - that I had the opportunity to read are very different in terms of tone, type of text, content management, and others, perhaps due to the instructions themselves . It would also be worth expanding relevance to other continents (the course is mainly contextguated in Europe and its emergency contexts) since Coursera is present worldwide. Thank you.

name: Primeros Auxilios Psicológicos (PAP)
reviews: I really liked the course, the issue is very interesting because all of us, at some point in our lives, face critical incidents and moments of crisis, everyday and massive, how we are facing at this time worldwide. Also at work level is very useful, especially when working in high-risk activities. A suggestion: There are some videos, especially on the topics of week 4 where some people were limited to reading, it was very little nice to see them only reading what one can perfectly do only. Thanks for sharing this valuable information. Happy day.

name: Primeros Auxilios Psicológicos (PAP)
reviews: It is a good start but the dynamics of the course is a bit heavy. The last two weeks are practically videos and it would be better to alternate with slides or other type of explanation. There are a couple of foreign-speaking videos that are really very heavy and very basic. Maybe you could use that space to be able to see the debriefing phases in full phases that is something that would be used a lot and in the course was plotted by half. name: Primeros Auxilios Psicológicos (PAP)
reviews: For those who want to enter this field of psychological first aid, it is a very complete course where all scenarios are covered, understood as populations and ways of approaching them. The only thing I missed, and the solution is unlikely, given that it is a totally virtual course, it is the application or the role games that could be interesting to apply the studied. Even so, the course has a series of videos where scenes are seen from how to make procedures and scenes where they do not apply correctly.

name: Primeros Auxilios Psicológicos (PAP)
reviews: It is a great course, it allows you to learn how to apply psychological first aid to different types of population and vulnerable sectors. It provides useful tools to provide coping and self-care guidelines for both people who live some critical incident and for intervening. It is a very complete course, it would only recommend that they will provide more theoretical material and scientific studies where the effectiveness of the proposed techniques was evaluated, otherwise, I recommend it widely.

name: Primeros Auxilios Psicológicos (PAP)
reviews: I found a very important course, since it helps us to be better prepared in the face of extraordinary situations. On the other hand, I appreciate the certificate that has issued us. I only have a question regarding the following legend "an online-free online course by Universitat Autònoma de Barcelona Yoofree through Coursera". What do you mean by: "No credit authorized by the Autonomous University of Barcelona"? Does it mean that it has no validity? Greetings and before hand thank you for your response.

name: Primeros Auxilios Psicológicos (PAP)
reviews: It is a very well structured course and taught by good psychology professionals specialists in psychological first aid (PAP). Muy recommended for all; I believe it should be taught in the teaching centers, where the population should be motivated in a culture related to emergency management. Anyone can be wrapped in an emergency of any kind and at any time, or it can help other people manage them.

name: Primeros Auxilios Psicológicos (PAP)

reviews: I loved, this has been my first course in Coursera, questioned the possibility of learning online, I think that the most challenging is that you must be constant, not miss the delivery dates, enter the platform every week and dedicate the necessary time, Outside of this, the additional material, the videos and the questionnaires show and evaluate just what is necessary for you to acquire competencies and resolve your doubts. The final evaluation was also of my liking, being able to review work of others and receive feedback from your colleagues about yours, it is a great way to continue learning. Thank you.

name: Primeros Auxilios Psicológicos (PAP)
reviews: Thank you very much to all my teachers Alicia Álvarez, Emilia Cruz and Ingeborg porcar for giving us the possibility of learning psychological first aid. His years of experience and knowledge show the quality and effectiveness of this course. Currently all humanity we are facing a pandemic that leaves in evidence how the leaders of our world prioritize the economy on the lives of people. However, this situation we can see it as a moment of change, of reflection, of transformation so that we establish A new world order, where we continue to fight for dignity and human rights, the care of our planet Earth and living beings, reflection on disproportionate and more important consumerism, continue to build us as political beings that we are aware and we generate consciousness about the History of our humanity, the importance of historical memory and taking actions that allow democracy. Thank you very much because as a degree in psychology, I am using the knowledge learned in this course to help my family, my father and brother who are doctors and need self-care guidelines to deal with the suffering of both people who die by Coronavirus without The company of his family, and family members who can not accompany them in their pain and departure. I am also using this knowledge to help my friends, neighbors and every person who requires my help. Greetings from Medellín- Colombia and again thank you. :)

name: Primeros Auxilios Psicológicos (PAP)
reviews: I am Lic. In Psychology. I love the course, as it is dictated, the material and training of professionals. While part of the material I have seen it throughout my college career, I loved the deepening of the theme, specializing the PAP in children according to the different ages, in adolescents, adults and special groups. Also self-care techniques or eat defusing and debriefing that although I had heard them in my career they had not deepened them, which is of great use for those who work in mental health. I also loved the role playing, of sum utility!. Thank you very much it has been a pleasure!

name: Primeros Auxilios Psicológicos (PAP)
reviews: It is an excellent course in first aid, very illustrative and with scenarios very attached to reality and to our context in El Salvador; For the work I carried out in an organization of attendance to young people and adults, a lot of work was carried out in crisis intervention and many of these tools we have used them and others in an empirical manner we do but have been up to this course that I know their formal academic part and which are of great support for the participants of the programs; Thank you very much for sharing your knowledge, your experiences and professionalism; I undoubtedly recommend this platform and special course at all kinds of people, because the tools are very useful at a personal, family, community, and society in general because we are always exposed to critical incidents or tragedies and it is important to know the approach that can be give to these emergencies and thus reduce the impact that causes us ... thanks for everything

name: Primeros Auxilios Psicológicos (PAP)
reviews: This course covers, briefly but accurately, containment and psychological consolation that must be given to almost all social groups, segmented by age and as a living condition (an example of this, is that I really liked the attention module in PAP to people with hearing and intellectual disabilities). To improve in progress, I suggest that, in the indications of the end project project, it is clarified if psychoeducatory guidelines for PAP in emergency situations must be written in first person, as if the / The Course Participant was already on the emergency scenario giving PAP to people affected by it, or it is enough for a third-party guide, describing the PAPs that the participant would apply when an emergency is presented. I have this suggestion because several of the people I qualified by the project had that confusion.

name: Primeros Auxilios Psicológicos (PAP)
reviews: For me  It has been very interesting to train me in this first aid course  Psychological (pap), I have learned how to intervene correctly in an emotional crisis,  this also allows me to be prepared for any emergency case,  because increasingly often we are socially exposed to  People in emotionally conflicting situations. We live in social times  very complex, where everyone at some point we have felt impotent against  a person who crosses a deep crisis of emotional pain: before the  Loss of a loved one or a natural catastrophe, an accident or in front of a  Diagnosis of a terminal disease. Therefore, it is necessary to be  prepared to provide immediate containment, and why not also to feel  the unmatched satisfaction of being able to help someone who is in a  difficult situation.

name: Primeros Auxilios Psicológicos (PAP)

I promise you that I will strive to make very good use and very good practice of all the knowledge learned in that course. Affection !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

name: Primeros Auxilios Psicológicos (PAP)

reviews: I regret that all the texts are in only English, that makes me impossible for me to continue with the course.

name: Social Psychology
reviews: The course of social psychology is exceptional, works the foundations of relations between people, provoking various reflections on how we can improve these relationships and intervene positively. As well as presents risks of being carried out by negative impulses for the lack of this reflection. It is a fascinating course in your format and content!

name: Social Psychology
reviews: I love this course! It presents the most relevant social psychology themes and in the most interesting way, so much so remind you of what you have ends up being easy. It has subtitles in Spanish for all classes. Congratulations to the organizers as Professor Scott and all the staff.

name: Social Psychology
reviews: I loved, all resources are extremely interesting and everyday examples allow you to learn more about people's behavior in such a complicated way. I have enjoyed it and the team's videos are the best. Honestly, I liked it a lot.

name: Social Psychology
reviews: This course is very well done. The teacher uses the technologies very well to expose all the information. Provides many extra options, either to read, either videos to see. This course is very good either to make us think and understand human interactions and ourselves.
reviewers: By João P A C S

name: Social Psychology
reviews: It is a great course for whoever is interested in the study of psychology or who is already psychological and wants to expand their knowledge in social psychology. You will learn multiple skills and you will achieve small (but significant) changes in your life.

name: Social Psychology

name: Agile with Atlassian Jira
reviews: I really liked the beginning of the course, with the most theoretical learning. However, the last two weeks of the course have frustrated me a little, for focusing more on the use of a program and less on aspects that I can take to any area of my work or life.

name: Agile with Atlassian Jira
reviews: The course has seemed very interesting and practical. As an improvement I propose that the software can be installed easily while the course lasts to practice all the theory. The course has been intense due to the amount of material to be treated. The material has been very complete, well explained and according to the marked objectives. It has extensively covered my expectations. Thank you very much and greetings. Liliana Gordillo Hernandez.

name: Fundamentals of Graphic Design
reviews: The course is fine, you learn basic aspects of graphic design and allow you to experiment with them. Its biggest problem is that the level of demand is very low, the most interesting projects are optional and at no time will a teacher correct you, but other students of the course (which many times put 0 effort in this correction). In spite of this I have learned and I recommend it to people who are starting in the world of graphic design, although it is better to take it as a self-learning than as a tutored course.

name: Fundamentals of Graphic Design
reviews: If you want to know the basic concepts of graphic design in a pleasant way this is your course. It is practically self-management but with a high quality instructional design.

name: Fundamentals of Graphic Design
reviews: It could improve in the use of questionnaires within and during the videos. There are not, and they would be useful. Questionnaires at the end and after many videos is not as effective.It would be good to ask the students to ask to be aware of making polite and polite corrections when grading and giving opinions about works. Aware that English is not the native language of all participants.There are no more Spanish subtitles in the rest of the specialized course, for those of us who do not speak English, we can no longer continue. We cannot take the rest of the courses, there are no more Spanish subtitles. It's a shame.Podría mejorar en el uso de cuestionarios dentro y durante de los videos. No los hay, y serian útiles. Cuestionarios al final y después de muchos videos no es tan efectivo.Seria bueno pedir a los alumnos que al calificar y dar opiniones sobre trabajos, se pida ser conscientes de hacer correcciones educadas y amables. Conscientes de que el inglés no es el idioma nativo de todos los participantes.Ya no hay subtítulos en español en el resto del curso especializado, para los que no hablamos inglés, ya no podemos seguir. No podemos tomar el resto de cursos, ya no hay subtítulos en español. Es una pena.

name: Fundamentals of Graphic Design
reviews: The course is great for getting well-initial concepts in graphic design. It does not deepen much, but offers the starting point for studies in the area and gives an overview.

name: Fundamentals of Graphic Design
reviews: It is an excellent course, but I feel that it can be more dynamic, it is very masterful to be a design course, that causes the classes a bit boring.

name: Fundamentals of Graphic Design
reviews: An excellent introductory course for those who wish to learn a little theory behind the graphic design.

name: Fundamentals of Graphic Design
reviews: It is a good course, I have learned in the first week more than in some of my years in the race.

name: Fundamentals of Graphic Design
reviews: This is a great course for getting into art in general. A lot of the course is very cursory and never goes too far into detail like some classes do, which can be overwhelming.The structure of required vs optional assignments was great, allowing you to choose where you'd like to practice more or even just additionally be able to continue (whereas some people cannot).I would highly recommend this course to everyone. I look forward to continuing the entire specialization when I have more time. Until a couple of months from now, CalArts - you have made me a happy student!

name: Fundamentals of Graphic Design
reviews: Initially Thanks to Coursera, Calarts and Professor Michael Worthington for the Partnership. The Course Is Excellent, Are Initial Foundations That Open The Vision For The Universe Of Graphic Design. I believe the fundamental Step Towns Building a good designer. I recommend.pt-Brinicially Thanks to the Coursera, Calarts and Professor Michael Worthington for the partnership. The course is excellent, are initial fundamentals that open the vision for the universe of graphic design. I believe that this is fundamental step for building a good designer. I recommend.

name: Fundamentals of Graphic Design
reviews: This course helped me learn in a simple and strategic way the basics of graphic design, or at least a good part. It is excellent, and everyone who is interested in starting in the design I recommend 100% the course. It is theoretical, practical and partly you have the peer advice on the projects that are going to elaborate.

name: Fundamentals of Graphic Design
reviews: All very well, I liked it a lot, the tasks seemed simple but perfect to understand what was being seen in the course. The videos are very clear, sometimes a bit heavy but good and with good content. It is recommended to leg those people who are interested and are about to start in this world.

name: Fundamentals of Graphic Design
reviews: I enjoyed a lot of the course. It was very didactic and I could understand much of the basic concepts of design. I would suggest that they can be a little more specific in the tasks and comment that it is something very simple since many things are lost in the interpretation. name: Python for Data Science and AI
reviews: I strongly suggest that you look into other providers for learning python for data science. As has been outlined by other reviewers, this is mostly a bad ad for IBM's Watson and there is little actual instruction for actually using Python.  As a background I'm a EE with a lot of hardware coding experience (Verilog as well as Perl).  I completed a specialization in Python from another provider and this gave me quite a bit of help as those classes were clear, with a good progression.  In addition I've now written a bit of Python for work so I have a good base.  This IBM course has, at best, cursory instruction on using Python, Numpy, and Pandas.  The instructions are not clear, with poor sentence structure, and terrible grammar, making it difficult to follow along.  Further, Watson is a confusing mess with instructions that use a prior UI, making it tough to figure out exactly what needs to be done to set up an environment.  Avoid.  Just avoid.  Go to UMich or JHU.  Anywhere but IBM.  The only thing I *did* get from this class is that I don't want to go into Data Science: living in Jupyter notebooks is miserable.  But then, I would also rather build things than write reports.  Your mileage may vary.

name: Python for Data Science and AI
reviews: Very good course, of the best I did on-line. The explanations are very clear, the pedagogy is excellent, all classes have their notebook. Really excellent. I did not participate in the forums but so I saw those responsible for the course they answer a lot.

name: Child Nutrition and Cooking
reviews:
Dear Employers and Chiefs of Coursera,
I came feeling proud to be able to go doing the free courses
granted by the so "prestigious" Stanford University, for its good
educational quality, but with what I just saw, in terms of human quality
It has left much to be desired. When I completed the courses so happy with
excellent notes, was totally arranged to buy my certificates, until
that I saw the following message "when scoring this box, I recognize that I provided
My legal name, that I am over 13 years old and that I am not from Iran, Sudan, Crimea or Cuba. " When reading this comment,
I began to feel indignant, pain, because it is entirely racist that for you
country of origin do not accept people from those countries Do you have something wrong with
be there? Are they fewer people to come from those countries? Do not they have the right to
Learn perhaps? I found it sad and outrageous that in the 21st century, they exist
Still this kind of exclusions, deceptive requirements are handling. No
they can have a certificate to come from those countries then, for that and with
my sincere apologies, I do not accept or accept any of the certificates,
because I can not have something like that in my curriculum, something while I enjoy it
Others by their country can not have it, then I consider it too unfair.
On my behalf and for the love that I have for people without distinction of
Nationality, I do not accept certificates. I have nothing to thank while
Keep seeing this limitation towards those countries. Greetings.

name: Introduction to Cybersecurity Tools & Cyber Attacks
reviews: This course is very summary-level. After taking, I realized the whole specialization/certificate would likely provide only a cursory overview of the field, and nothing close to what would be required get a job in this area. I think one could learn more about cybersecurity from perusing wikipedia than they could with this course. Additionally, this course seems hastily put together, with many different speakers from lesson to lesson. Each host offers a wildly different level of knowledge and didactic ability. I get the feeling the lessons were spliced together from some sort of internal training process, where the cyber team was trying to educate management and other departments on what exactly they do. The arbitrary nature of quiz questions reinforces the idea that not much thought was put into the overall informational value of this course.

reviews: I am quite satisfied with what I learned in this initial course of the Data Science program since it is a good introduction to everything that will be seen later. I must say as an IT professional that has surprised me how it starts from scratch explaining everything necessary to understand and install the necessary computer tools for the course with an almost beginner level. However, regarding statistical methods and data analysis, the level is not so low and the videos of week 3 have already deepened in some concepts of data analysis. I hope that in the following courses are explained in detail from scratch.

It is the second course I take in Coursera and the same thing happens to me, two renowned universities that do not provide any credit. What is the goal of bidding then?

name: The Data Scientist’s Toolbox

At the time of my commentary is everything in English and that is not a disadvantage but if you are not good with the language as I will touch some extra steps to translate the text, however it is not something that prevents learning.

name: The Data Scientist’s Toolbox

This type of topics seems to me that it is more interesting to see it as a tutorial; Where as the theory is explained, it is showing how to do it in x language, either, python, c # or another.

name: Convolutional Neural Networks
reviews:
Este curso introductorio es estupendo para aprender desde cero sobre convolutional neural networks.

Professor Andrew Ng, makes very comprehensible the content of the course.
 
Here why:

-He decompose every element of CNN. Convolutions, 1x1 convolutions and  pooling are very well explained, then by yourself can derive the dimensions of the output after applying these operations.
-He make notes on the fly for derive equations and  explain the purpose of the equations.  For me is much better that  only show slides, because makes give me the oportunity to think of the equation before is show.
-Professor give you  Intiition in every topic.
- He Make several examples of modern architectures of CNNs.Always write down in detail the architectures. 
-Clear notation, uses the same notation in programming exercises 
-Programming exercises are the best documente ones. This makes relatively easy to implement the exercises. If struggle with operations, they provide links to the documentation necessary.

Was an amazing course. 

Althogth I always think CNNs were some what  difficult and sometimes tedious topic (because of convolution and pooling arithmetic, and the use of "volumes" instead of matrices), this course make all clear and natural.

Thanks to the instructors for they hard work.

name: Convolutional Neural Networks
reviews: This is a Very Interting and Functional Course. Week 1 Gives You The Basic Ideas Behind CNN and It Is Very Easy To Follow The Videos. The Next Weeks Gives You What Are Under The Hood In Object Detection Systems, Other CNN Architectures, STYLE USE ... I Recommend This Coursete is an interesting and mostly functional course. The first week teaches you the basic ideas behind a CNN besides that you are easy readings to follow. The following weeks teach you the "secrets" of the object detection site, other CNN architectures, artistic use of them ... I recommend the course

reviews: It is a very practical course, it did not have so many prior knowledge of political theories however understanding the explanations of the teacher, I did not get difficult anyway, the contrary, the concepts were super understandable. name: Moral Foundations of Politics
reviews:
My name is Alejandro Alfonzo Abdala and I am very grateful to this course. I am a politician graduated from the University of Venezuela who had to leave the country for the social and political conditions that we live, when I arrived at my new Mexico country, I tried to find a job in my career as a political analyst but by the urgency of needing money, I have had to accept another type of unrelated jobs. However, having found this free course was an opportunity to meet again with what I love the political sciences and have been able to learn and review concept, no matter how many nights stop sleeping early to be able to finish it. I look forward to the next course of Professor Shapiro and I hope to have the money to pay for the certificate, really thank you very much for the dedication of making this type of courses.

My Name Is Alejandro Alfonzo Abdala And I am Very Grateful for This Course. I AM A Political Scientist Graduated from The University of Venezuela Who Had To Leave The Country Due To The Social and Political Conditions We Live In, When i Arrived In My New Country Mexico, I Tried To Find Employment In My Career AS A Political Analyst BUT Because of the Urgency of Needing Money, I Have Had to Accept Other Types of Unrelated Jobs. However, Having Found This Free Course Was An Opportunity To Meet Again What I Love Most In Political Science And To Have Been Able To Learn And Review The Concept, Not Matter How Many Nights I Stopped Sleeping Early To Finish IT. I Am Looking Forward To The Next Course of Professor Shapiro And I Hope to Have The Money To Pay For The Certificate, Really Thank You Very Much For The Dedication of Doing This Type Of Course.

name: Moral Foundations of Politics
reviews: Really an excellent course. For those who are passionate about politics and public administration, there is always an area of gray that are public policies and the reason. That that Professor Ian Shapiro developed us as the moral foundations, allows us in full 2020 to have a better approach to the foundations of them, what motivates them, what is hidden in the speeches and if perhaps such or that announcement or government action have An ideological-moral correlate or if they are merely unfortunate. I appreciate the possibility and encourage you to participate! Thank you Yale, thank Ian Shapiro.

name: Moral Foundations of Politics
reviews: Ian Shapiro has arranged them to maintain a very ambitious level of deepening being both very pleasant and didactic, clear, understandable for everyone. He has overcome my expectations and what I learned here today I use it in my classes. Finally, the course analyzes issues on which we need to discuss today in terms of public policies. Undoubtedly, it is a valuable course that I recommend doing, and a sample that Coursera meets when promising affordability and quality at a time.

name: Moral Foundations of Politics
reviews: I found an excellent course to analyze the policy more in depth and knowing that moral and ideological bases are based on each theory. I also help me improve my thought not to fall as mentioned in the emotivist culture of being a passional soldier of any idea, person Or system. And in that way analyze the history and philosophy more understanding, listening to the various bells and having a more real approach to the truth.

name: Moral Foundations of Politics
reviews: An excellent course. The professor, Ian Shapiro, explains with amazing clarity and equanimity the different schools of political thought. Highly recommended for anyone with some interest in politics, philosophy or humanities in general.

name: Moral Foundations of Politics

name: Cryptography I
reviews: Excellent introduction to cryptography for those with little to no prior knowledge of the subject.Would recommend becoming familiar with number theory as a precursor, as this underpins many of the concepts introduced. While not essential (as the basics are covered and references are provided to support material), the focus is much more on cryptography than mathematics.Lectures are well structured and build on each other in a logical progression. Exercise questions are well thought out, and effectively test understanding of the modules. I would also recommend undertaking the optional programming exercises, as these tend to throw up practical issues that may not always be apparent from the course notes.

name: Cryptography I
reviews: A very thorough and rigorous course covering the primitives of modern cryptography. While all the math needed is included in the course, I highly recommend you have some kind of background in how mathematical proofs work, as the notation and ability to follow the logic of all the symbols can be overwhelming if you're new to them. Professor Boneh is excellent, and even a cursory internet search shows that he is highly regarded in his field. It was a privilege learning from someone so knowledgable, and I look forward to Cryptography II whenever it is released.

name: Cryptography I
reviews: This course, taught by the Great Professor Dan Bonh, is wonderful, to say the least. It shows the theory didatically, in order to facilitate the mathematics of the subject that is very arid, but also introduces important practical aspects for those militite in the particular area with software specification and development. The exams, in addition to simple learning evaluation, were great tools to fix and improve understanding of content.

name: Cryptography I

name: Using Python to Interact with the Operating System
reviews: Not pleased with the challenge of using my own machine, and having to be kept to the arbitrary 1.5 hours of the Qwiklabs.  Some of us need more time to work through stuff and to try different approaches.  That "nano" IDE is horrendous - I can't figure out how to copy and paste, and moving that damned cursor is crazy.  We need the option of working all this stuff out on our own machine, and then copying it into the Qwiklabs.

reviews: The content is adequate and because it is an introductory course is quite complete. In the end this hinders learning, if you have a good rhythm having to do things 3 and 4 times it seems a little exaggerated. Anyway, I take a good experience since the problems have finally been resolved. I have to add that the problems mentioned above I think are more quizlabs problems. name: Camino a la Excelencia en Gestión de Proyectos
reviews:
I am quite restless and took at least 3 to 4 a year and this is my second experience with courser and I leave these comments as a contribution to a course that its content promises a lot but at the end is: 1) project management is a very interesting topic and gives you multiple tools to analyze, organize and improve the conceptual models of a project, besides delivering a different look at the time of working again with a multidisciplinary team, the course creates an educational flow that is well conceivable but weak time to deliver the contents.

2) The course is very focused on the construction and manufacturing industry, although at some point the services industry is often mentioned, there are no concrete examples that allow understanding the improvements and advantages of its in these and other markets.

3) Although it is noted that both rapporteurs have extensive knowledge of the topics covered, a lack of preparation is evident when preparing the contents to be recorded. There are many gaps between what you read and the idea that you want express with different words and confuse and retake the thread after a lagoon. This is a point to be improved. Suggestion: We should record the videos to correct the obvious errors and continuity in the presentation of theme.
4) A possible additional improvement: upload documentation with a couple of practical examples where the content taught and that would give May consistency and weight to the course, which in my final balance does not exceed a note 5.9.

name: Camino a la Excelencia en Gestión de Proyectos
reviews: The content of the course is good. However, there are some improvement points that I share below: the quality of the videos makes the visualization of some elements of the presentations difficult. For example, on the topic of Report A3, what is exposed in its example is not clearly observed. In addition, the image of the teacher obstructs the complete visualization of the content. At certain videos are heard some inconsistencies that could confuse the students. In the theme of Value Stream Mapping, greater emphasis should be made on its structure and correct way to present it. By reviewing assignments to my colleagues, I was able to realize that the subject was not understood and plotted a simple diagram that neither nearby is a VSM. By my professional training dominates a bit the subject and I managed to elaborate it as similar to what a true VSM is, but not all those who take the course have used this tool, so I consider it very important to be clearer and more emphatically explaining it .

name: Camino a la Excelencia en Gestión de Proyectos
reviews: Excellent learning material, very punctual at the time of approaching the various topics. The examples used are very conventional and practical for understanding. Solo as a constructive criticism, could be limited, the reinforcement of instructors with respect to the diction, since in some parts it is listened a little under their tone of voice, as well as some Explanations where a minimum reading error or explanation is committed with respect to the sheet that is being projected, which tends to confuse. But it is not something constant Ki that has conditioned the understanding in general, but if it was good to review those details. For the rest, very happy to have done this course, even when it is not my specific professional area, it can be used to try to move it to My professional performance.

name: Camino a la Excelencia en Gestión de Proyectos
reviews: I only have two observations: 1.-regarding content, it seems to me that you should work on the translation of the videos of week 5, since white subtitles are lost on many occasions, making it possible to read and understanding the exposed. 2. In the reviews, feedback should be mandatory, especially when the maximum score is not granted. At this point, it would be interesting that one of the 3 grades be part of an academic of Lean philosophy, since they are finally the ones who possess the specific fundamentals to correct because they are experts in the field. I appreciate for the knowledge that were transmitted through the course and for the good disposition and participation of colleagues.

name: Camino a la Excelencia en Gestión de Proyectos
reviews: Dear; First of all I would like to thank the course (and its null cost). It is a good learning that adds knowledge to those already acquired in the project area. Sincerely, Rodrigo Cerda.

I Clara Pinilla Moscoso, I work with research projects in environmental sciences. This course was wonderful and very practical, oriented by experts on the subject and ends with some testimonials from different managers, project leaders from USA, Israel, Brazil, England, which from different perspectives discloses the evolution, progress and future of Culture read in project management.

I learned, about the Lean culture for project management, for example, the application of Choosing and Advantages analysis (CBA), and the analysis, scale of the importance of advantages and the advantage of costs and the implementation of the solution
In the same way, the work of VALUE STREAM MAPPING is very interesting that by means of a table, the application of analysis is expressed, considers the stages and indicators, current status of identification, loss, and through the diagram I found interesting roads for Apply it to research projects in present state and improvements on the map Future State and in Choosing and Advantages Analysis (CBA).

name: Dog Emotion and Cognition
reviews: Very interesting. As a vegan person, some of the examples and experiments mentioned, carried out with other animals in captivity and some not precisely in optimal conditions have not seemed necessary, and rather they have provoked negative feelings, especially if we take into account that the course is About dogs. But in general the theories and the topics covered in the course have seemed very interesting. I believe that all the people who have a dog should understand a little better to these family members and this course can be a first step towards that understanding.

name: Dog Emotion and Cognition

I want to explore and understand your cognitive part even more and join me to the Dognition study. I also see other species otherwise, namely the birds, which are so close to us and still so distant. Very interested and clear teacher in the presentation of the course! I highly recommend.

name: The Sustainable Development Goals – A global, transdisciplinary vision for the future
reviews: The course was quite broad allowing the understanding of the content of the ODS, but essentially, the understanding of the causes that led to the determination of these objectives. On the other hand it became very clear that the methodology to deal with sustainable development should be deeply altered, in order to meet the global needs of human beings (fundamental human rights), as well as their interaction with the environment, thus leaving If traditional quantitative metrics based on economic growth indicators, especially GDP. In fact, the course is an appeal to a change in the way of thinking and acting of all actors in the development process that share, with the same rights and duties, the only planet that everyone has.

name: The Sustainable Development Goals – A global, transdisciplinary vision for the future
reviews: A good course to understand the objectives of sustainable development (ODS) and their relationship with society. It has good support material for deepening on the relationship of sustainable development objectives (ODS) with the planet and how they explore their resources. It encompasses progress ideas related to the planet damage and how the ODS contribute to the cooling of the anthropic action to the planet in an extraordinary way.

name: Learn to Speak Korean 1
reviews: Excellent for beginners. Thank you very much for all your work, really this course was very good for me. I just wanted to suggest the following: it seems very good to participate foreign students, but I think it would be better if more Koreans will participate in most of the situations, so we can accustom the ear to the pronunciation of the natives of the language. On the other hand, I think it would be very useful if there were additional videos (short-term) on some important issues about Korean culture. Again, thank you very much!

name: Learn to Speak Korean 1

name: Learn to Speak Korean 1

name: Learn to Speak Korean 1
reviews: A very useful course if you already learned the Korean alphabet and you have basic notions of Korean grammar. I believe that some people, like me, that we are studying the Korean language and we do not live in Korea nor do we have a friend with whom to practice the spoken way every day, we can feel a little insecure about how to form sentences correctly. But this course helps land in an easy way how are basic prayers and daily life in Korean and really helped me a lot to lay the foundations that I had already learned, review vocabulary and see real examples of how Korean is spoken.

name: Learn to Speak Korean 1
reviews: I think it's a pretty useful course, and if you know the Korean alphabet and minimum numbers from 1 to 10 (both in the native and Chinese system) it will be easier for you to understand the lessons and pass the Quiz with good score, and although there is 1 or 2 lessons in which you will get bored with so much grammar, I think if you have perseverance you achieved it, because the last lessons are very easy and do not bore at all, I recommend this course a lot, all the lessons are very well explained, and when you finish the Course you can talk or understand more fluidly certain expressions

name: Learn to Speak Korean 1
reviews: The course I liked a lot since I could understand everything, you can see the effort in the realization of the modules, the best way to associate the vicabulary with the modules. Super recommended

name: R Programming
reviews: The evaluations do not have the same level as classes. You see themes in the videos so that when doing the exam it is introduced (brief and very poorly) other functions and structures that were never mentioned before. During the videos you show features that are seen until weeks later. I do not recommend the course. I learned more through Swirl's modules.

name: R Programming
reviews: There is a gigantic abyss between the lectures, the  Exercises presented in "assignments" and the coding required to pass on tasks. Example  that, I did not need tools  to address the classes and "swirl" with what I feel comfortable in using.This is a huge loss for learning objectives  of the course. In several moments, I thought about giving up because of this  consideration. I have experience in sas coding, I am traditionally a  Good student, so this is frustrating.

name: R Programming
reviews: Practical exercises do not enter as much detail as evaluations do and are very easy. Improving that (a swirl package or other additional) experience would be much better and true would feel that I learned the course well.

name: R Programming
reviews: The course materials do not give you enough to complete the assignments. The coverage is only cursory and you need to do a lot more extra work and research to get even close to the standard required to do the final assignments.

name: R Programming
reviews: The course was a rapid cursory introduction to R. This being said, I recommend breaking the course into multiple separate courses and including more depth (with further practice) to guarantee that the student has truly achieved mastery. I supplemented the course with courses from  DataCamp and Udemy, and only now (after completing the course here on Coursera, reading the textbook(s), and additional practice through the online training by Udemy and DataCamp) can I say that I am gaining true proficiency in R. This being said, the course was very well organized, had great examples, and excellent lectures (although the audio could be clarified by quite a bit using a higher-end microphone, preamp, interface, and affordable audio production software such as Reaper to clarify the voice).

name: R Programming
reviews: It is a course that requires quite some time because the programming tasks of weeks 3 and 4 can be very frustrating, I was about to leave but with the help of the forums I could do all the tasks perfectly. However, it took me more time of the planned. I recommend checking the forums as soon as you finish reading the instructions for programming tasks to avoid losing interest. I enjoyed it, I felt challenged and reinforced my previous knowledge of R in functions.

name: R Programming
reviews: The course was very good, but neither the book of the class nor the videos was related to the evaluations. I would have liked more explanations to complex problems. In my case, it has served me -Admás- to improve my English language -writer and diction. The teacher speaks very well the English. Saludos and thank you very much.
