name: Chinese for Beginners
reviews: I made this course in parallel to the Chinese class that I am currently taking and helped me to reinforce what I already knew and clarify doubts. In addition to adding a lot of vocabulary and advancing small concepts. The explanations are clear and the lessons are accumulating over the previous classes. Being able to listen to the tones several times helps themselves better. The suggested exercises are very useful and it is essential to perform them to set it learned little by little. I think the only thing I would add would be to introduce the characters from the beginning but I can understand that they postpone it for the next level. Extremely recommended.

name: Chinese for Beginners
reviews: Honestly did not have previous experience in online courses and I found it good to start something different. I was surprised to see the good and simple that can be a good course in many aspects. An excellent course !! A great tool of introduction to this language, easy-to-understand information and association techniques that helped me a lot to locate the idea in each context and the correct pronunciation. It has a progressive advance, and it is very entertaining. Good support material that encourages you to continue studying !! I would do it again if necessary. Thank you for this opportunity

name: Chinese for Beginners
reviews: I liked the course structure: basic knowledge for personal presentation, numbers and alphabet, days of the week, months of the year, as if locating in relation to an address, such as ordering food and drink, asking and saying the hours, shopping on hobbies. The course provides an introduction to the language that allows a basic but important conversation for beginners, especially with regard to intonations (tones). It highlights here, the didactics of Professor Xiaoyu Liu, which presents the contents in order to facilitate the understanding of students.

name: Sequences, Time Series and Prediction
reviews: The first week has some interesting discussion of time series data and some traditional non-ML methods for forecasting, but beyond that the course quickly divulges the all too familiar weaknesses of this specialization; lack of depth, elementary discussion, weak insight into common problems that arise during training models, and extremely poorly written quizzes that don't test the learner's gain of knowledge or skills in any meaningful way.My biggest complaint to the instructors and the team is that for months this specialization promised the last course will discuss the WaveNet model, but the course didn't even do a cursory survey of it (In week 4, the instructor adds a Conv1D layer but doesn't even discuss the causal padding and completely skips dilations, etc, so that in effect there isn't even discussion of a single layer from WaveNet model).  Sigh !

name: Nutrición y obesidad: control de sobrepeso
reviews: The course has very basic information, use good language, easy to understand for the general public, however I feel sorry that one of the most recognized institutions in the country still manage such obsolete information, the prospecting brochure is based on the survey National Nutrition 2012, there are more recent surveys, the official norm which the last revision is also over 6 years old, the "greater consumption foods by the Savior Hospital Zubirán of 1996" (more than 20 years ago), the Institute of Public health has very recent publications about the health landscape in Mexico, and is not said of the Salvador Institute Zubirán, very obsolete recommendations continue to be given, as I insist on the 8 water vessels, time ago the WHO clarified that water consumption It has to meet the needs of the person, unless this suffer from a specific condition as kidney problems, ascites, etc. They continue to use the system of exchanges when the well-eating plate is a more precise material; And to finish the area of ​​physical activity is also very simplistic, the person of the video who exercises does not bring adequate clothing and does not perform the exercises properly. I am nutriously, I like to take these courses to see what kind of material is accessible to people in general, I am sure that if they take a tour of other courses that offer on this same platform will be very useful to improve this course, such as Nutrióloga And as Mexicana it gave me a lot of embarrassment to see this material, and then I fall into account because we have the health crisis we have.

name: Nutrición y obesidad: control de sobrepeso
reviews: Good Morning. I appreciate the possibility of accessing education through this platform. However, on the course of nutrition, this does not evidence new research on nutrition and dietary. Manage obsolete concepts, such as the fact of eating at least 6 times a day, when recent research leads us to our ancestors where human beings should not eat so much because they did not fit food so easily. Fasting is a good strategy for organ work as a liver. On the other hand, there is a mixture of high density carbohydrates in the nutritional pyramids. Very respectfully I suggest that the content of this program is re-evaluated and updated with the new advances in nutrition and dietary.

name: Nutrición y obesidad: control de sobrepeso
reviews: The course, the information and the explanation of the topics is very good, but one of the activities has incorrect responses in the comparison to qualify; I do not know if you are wrong or the people who understood and only qualify with what you put. I'm glad I would not have paid the course

name: Nutrición y obesidad: control de sobrepeso
reviews: Very badly, the mode of qualifying, the whole course would appear contradictory qualifications on the one hand, they told me approved and in the qualifications section I was farewell and I always keep time with the tasks. appalling

name: Nutrición y obesidad: control de sobrepeso
reviews: Good afternoon, I am a doctor, with preparation in food and sporting plans; I enrolled in the course with the expectation of new knowledge; However, I stopped with the bad taste of mouth to see that the assessment of overweight and obesity patients was not adequately taught, since in this course they indicate people (aspirants or prepared in the field of nutrition) to Assess your patients based on a table, and so it is not the proper assessment of a patient. In this type of aspart assessment, they put a patient with a weight of 68 kg which measures 1.58 is in obesity grade 1 (for example), this being completely wrong; Since it is 27.30, which places this patient overweight; And this way that exemplifies is repeated during the whole course.Other aspect that I found bad praxis or that it can not understand, is how do I ideal or accurately for the patient? And this type of calculation, request it in the latest activities to be done, when requested to calculate the correct weight of it, since, if we remember, an ideal weight BMI goes from 18.5 to 24.9.

name: Nutrición y obesidad: control de sobrepeso
reviews: The truth is that the course is cute and concise, but unfortunately perpetual many of the bad conceptions and pseudoscientific of human nutrition. I disappoint a little that coming from an institution like the UNAM and a person at the presenter level, do not have more useful things for people as tips so as not to consume products like Light Mayonnaise because they have starchs to compensate for the lack of fat and give it "Body" to emulsion. Or that puts an integral bread is better than a white bread, when in essence it is the same. Or that put people to plan telling calories when we know that macromolecules do not metabolize the same in our organism and good ... it's a long etcetera.

name: Nutrición y obesidad: control de sobrepeso
reviews: Good afternoon. Actually the course is not updated. The person who teaches it on the first day has committed several errors. For example, it says that about weight is a person with an BMI greater than 27 "according to WHO" when really literatures and WHO talks about overweight than 25kgs / m2. He says that he is talking about obesity when the abdominal circumference is in man over 95 and in women greater than 85 cms. When the literature really speaks us of greater than 88 in women and greater than 102 cms in men. I recommend them to give courses seek qualified and updated people.

name: Nutrición y obesidad: control de sobrepeso
reviews: The certificate should be placed the rating with which I approved the course, it should also say in this Certificate that the course is approval because I have given evidence and has presented tasks and has not only been a participation, I really feel disappointed, in my country Ecuador The certificate serves me if you have the aforementioned data otherwise you have no validity, I ask you to fix that please. my rating would be higher if they help me running what you order, thank you for the course I loved it, very well explained

name: Nutrición y obesidad: control de sobrepeso
reviews: I think the course needs to increase your topics and go more towards quality of diet and habits creation, more than counting calories in a standard plan to lose weight. I would have liked it to talk about more of physical activity based on heart rate and exercise plan design for overweight and obesity people, as well as more psychological tools for their handling from the nutritionist.

name: Nutrición y obesidad: control de sobrepeso

reviews: As a personal coach, Coach on Nutrition I have researcher, this course has many serious problems, based on current scientific evidence, placing only on the menus list and giving choice options with sugar seems terrible, apart the option of snacks, is demonstrated that if you have complete and balanced feeding you do not need from them, they place little saluble options such as loaves and cookies, apart poor options of protein and healthy fats, which are the ones that should be fundamental because they give us satiety, all the calories, the case of the person obese type II was the worst of all, in real life If this person is recommended those evil plans never Saldrade that hollow of addiction in which this

name: Nutrición y obesidad: control de sobrepeso
